data.title: Feature Request: Drag/split current file in editor
data.body:
<!-- Do you have a question? Please ask it on http://stackoverflow.com/questions/tagged/vscode -->

- VSCode Version: 1.8.1
- OS Version: Windows 7 Professions SP1

In VS15/17 (and maybe others) there is a feature in the editor window to click and drag from the top right corner and split the current file you're looking at so you can edit the same page from two points (or reference from one and code in another, etc). You can then just drag back up and go back to the single pane edit at any time. This is much easier than having multiple windows open in the same file, and would be greatly appreciated.

data.title: TS error shows /$cwd/ path for files with errors
data.body:
- VSCode Version: Code - Insiders 1.11.0-insider (acfe8468e647f6a42c015c47c28610da9aecdce3, 2017-03-16T07:39:00.414Z)
- OS Version: Darwin x64 16.4.0
Executed with `--disable-extensions`

I'm sure it was working before today's update.

Running `tsc` from command line I get the errors:

```
backend/apps/bot/BotRenderer.ts(68,9): error TS2322: Type '{ host: null; bot_url: null; icon: string; animation: ChatIconAnimation; position: ChatIconPositi...' is not assignable to type 'Settings'.
  Property 'showHidePopupForUrl' is missing in type '{ host: null; bot_url: null; icon: string; animation: ChatIconAnimation; position: ChatIconPositi...'.
frontend/chat-loader/backend-helpers.ts(7,9): error TS2322: Type '{ simulation: boolean; bot_url: string; host: string; icon: string; animation: ChatIconAnimation;...' is not assignable to type 'Settings'.
  Property 'showPopup' is missing in type '{ simulation: boolean; bot_url: string; host: string; icon: string; animation: ChatIconAnimation;...'.
```

VScode shows this:

![image](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/1723815/24005470/7c615ec8-0a3f-11e7-847e-3760c135a882.png)

Notice `/$cwd/..`

When I click that then I get:
![image](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/1723815/24005500/907369a6-0a3f-11e7-8c01-d7a1dcbb8cc0.png)


My `tsconfig.json`:

```json
{
    "compilerOptions": {
        "outDir": "./build",
        "sourceMap": true,
        "target": "es5",
        "module": "commonjs",
        "moduleResolution": "node",
        "isolatedModules": false,
        "jsx": "react",
        "experimentalDecorators": true,
        "emitDecoratorMetadata": true,
        "declaration": false,
        "noImplicitAny": true,
        "noImplicitThis": false,
        "noImplicitUseStrict": false,
        "skipLibCheck": true,
        "skipDefaultLibCheck": true,
        "forceConsistentCasingInFileNames": true,
        "noUnusedLocals": false,
        "noUnusedParameters": false,
        "removeComments": true,
        "noLib": false,
        "preserveConstEnums": true,
        "suppressImplicitAnyIndexErrors": true,
        "strictNullChecks": false,
        "allowJs": false,
        "baseUrl": ".",
        "lib": [ "es2015.promise", "es5", "dom" ],
        "paths": {
            "base/*": [
                "base/*"
            ],
            "common/*": [
                "common/*"
            ],
            "frontend/*": [
                "frontend/*"
            ],
            "backend/*": [
                "backend/*"
            ]
        }
    },
    "exclude": [
        "node_modules",
        "bower_components",
        "jspm_packages",
        "native",
        "public",
        ".vscode"
    ],
    "compileOnSave": false,
    "buildOnSave": false
}
```

data.title: Proposal fix 22401: Search in settings editor is showing invalid results for search term
data.body:
Related issue: #22401 

The error was related to what I described in the issue comment:

The problem is in the _matchesPrefix method in `base\common\filter.ts`

```typescript
	const wordChar = word.charCodeAt(i);
	const wordToMatchAgainstChar = wordToMatchAgainst.charCodeAt(i)
```
"4"=52 and for "T"= 84

If the difference between them are 32 or -32 (uppercase==lowercase), it is a match. But the method was checking for Alphanumeric characters instead of AsciiLetter.

`base\common\strings.ts` is an example where this is also used.

data.title: Feature request: context or syntax suggestion not must according to the order of user's typing
data.body:
For example, if I type "prln", then "PrintLn" should appeared (Like in Sublimetext), and that word inputed automatically just by pressing ENTER.  I think this helps people to write code easily and speedily.

But now I have to type more characters or press Up/Down to locate "PrintLn".

I think Word Suggestion is used to type less word not type almost whole word according to the suggestion.

data.title: Prevent wrongly cased file paths to enter the workbench

milestone.title: Backlog
milestone.description: Work not yet planned for a specific release.

data.body:
Follow up from https://github.com/Microsoft/vscode/issues/12448. We now no longer open 2 different files when using different casing for a file path (macOS, Windows) but we can do better and prevent wrongly-cased paths altogether. 

We should identify the places where paths are coming in that we cannot trust in terms of casing (e.g. output from the terminal) and then convert this path to the real path when opening in the editor. 

Finding out the real path as it is on disk is unfortunately not possible with node.js APIs. We have a helper method ([here](https://github.com/Microsoft/vscode/blob/master/src/vs/base/node/extfs.ts#L383)) that walks each parent folder until the file is reached to find out the actual casing.

A better approach would be to write a native module that does this in one call ideally. We could try to use [`uv_fs_realpath`](https://github.com/libuv/libuv/pull/531), keeping in mind the [caveats](https://github.com/saghul/libuv/commit/6938f6b0bdbcfd40d7e0cdd3ff298cf46b3dca0d) though. 

node.js once [used](https://github.com/nodejs/node/pull/3594/files) `uv_fs_realpath` inside `fs.realpath` but took it out again due to the issues documented.

A [wrapper](https://github.com/isaacs/fs.realpath/blob/master/index.js) exists to deal with the error cases.

data.title: Improve UX for terminal switcher control. Change the dropdown for a switcher control
data.body:
In the spirit of the following issues:

https://github.com/Microsoft/vscode/issues/10546
https://github.com/Microsoft/vscode/issues/11889
https://github.com/Microsoft/vscode/issues/8073

It would be great to replace the dropdown control in the terminal pane that indicates what terminal window has the focus to a more user friendly control. Having to click twice is annoying and unnecessary. 

Instead of a dropdown control, a switcher control that displays an icon for each terminal window could be used.

Here's how it might look like:

![image](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/89523/24001183/d4878cfa-0a33-11e7-847c-853c1ff4386b.png)

The first character in the box is the order at which you opened the terminal and the second char is the type of terminal in that window.

That way, you have one click to focus on the terminal you need and it works with split view, tabs, etc.

data.title: Syntax errors when reexporting default in index.js file
data.body:
- VSCode Version: Code 1.10.2 (8076a19fdcab7e1fc1707952d652f0bb6c6db331, 2017-03-08T13:56:35.908Z)
- OS Version: Darwin x64 16.3.0
- Extensions: 

|Extension|Author|Version|
|---|---|---|
|ejs-language-support|QassimFarid|0.0.1|
|jsx|TwentyChung|0.0.1|
|python|donjayamanne|0.5.5|
|autoimport|steoates|1.2.2|
|ReactSnippets|xabikos|1.2.0|
|Material-theme|zhuangtongfa|2.2.7|;


---

Hi! I have a very unpleasant bug with reexporting default submodule export in index files. It is a very common case for me and it works with current bundler (Webpack), but looks broken in the editor.

Steps to Reproduce:

1. Create `submodule.js` file with following content: 

```
export default function DefaultExport () {}
export function TestExport () {}
```
2. Create `index.js` with reexports:
```
export default from './submodule1.js';
export TestExport from './submodule1.js';
```

VS Code highlights reexports as syntax errors and breaks "Go To Definition" logic, which is very useful.

![](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/654461/23992643/b930af3e-0a4e-11e7-96fc-47f87e55b3ee.png)

Here is my jsconfig.json file:
```
{
    "compilerOptions": {
        "target": "ES6",
        "jsx": "react"
    },
    "exclude": [
        "node_modules",
        "build",
        "tools",
        ".idea"
    ]
}
```

Thanks!

data.title: TypeScript "Add missing import" root path and quotes configuration
data.body:
- VSCode Version: 1.20.2
- OS Version: Windows Server 2008 R2 Enterprise

Steps to Reproduce:

1. write some code with type not yet imported to the file ex. `x: SomeType;`
2. place cursor on the type - yelow lightbulb shows up in the gutter
3. click it and select "Import SomeType from "app/common/some-type"

problems which could be fixed with config options:
1. the inserted "from" path starts with "app" which is kind of absolute but not really - my dir structure is `<project>/src/app/...`, where <project> is the folder opened in vscode. in my team we prefer paths relative to the edited file.
2. the "from" path is surrounded with double-quotes - some projects use single-quotes and tslint shows warnings.

data.title: [sql] Add more keywords to the default highlighter
data.body:
- VSCode Version: 1.10.2
- OS Version: Windows 10

Steps to Reproduce:

1. The default SQL highlighter does not see some of the keywords.

![image](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/1008059/23985464/539c5bb2-0a73-11e7-8817-7da6e8b09731.png)

data.title: consuming 100% cpu on windows server

milestone.title: Backlog
milestone.description: Work not yet planned for a specific release.

data.body:
Hi,

 I've installed vscode on a AWS windows server. Whenever opening vscode, it starts consuming 100% cpu by default. I've not installed any plugins yet and version is up to date.

data.title: Case preserving but case insensitive file handling
data.body: Fixes https://github.com/Microsoft/vscode/issues/12448

data.title: Add ripgrep support
data.body:
Disabled by default, can be enabled via `search.useRipgrep`.

For #19983

data.title: feature request: when focus in the file explorer, press a-z to navagate to the file like in windows file explorer
data.body:
![ds](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/5009757/23983556/bb895708-0a4f-11e7-9783-994b403f156b.gif)

if press r it will select runOrSwitch.ahk, then press t, the test.ahk will be selected again, and press t again, the test.ahk.back will be selected.
